actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1038.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Finance with amendment, S. Rept. 95-1112.
House agreed to Senate amendments with amendments.

official_title: An Act to amend section 5064 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide for refund of tax on distilled spirits, wines, rectified products, and beer lost or rendered unmarketable due to fire, flood, casualty, or other disaster, or to breakage, destruction, or other damage (excluding theft) resulting from vandalism or malicious mischief while held for sale.

summary.as: House agreed to Senate amendment with amendment
summary.text: (House agreed to Senate amendments with amendments) Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide for the refund of excise taxes paid on alcoholic beverages where the beverages are destroyed prior to final sale through disaster, breakage or destruction resulting from vandalism or malicious mischief.

titles.title: A bill to amend certain provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to authorize refund of tax on distilled spirits, wines, rectified products, and beer lost or rendered unmarketable due to fire, flood, casualty, or other disaster, or breakage, destruction, or other damage (excluding theft) resulting from vandalism or malicious mischief while held for sale.

An Act to amend section 5064 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide for refund of tax on distilled spirits, wines, rectified products, and beer lost or rendered unmarketable due to fire, flood, casualty, or other disaster, or to breakage, destruction, or other damage (excluding theft) resulting from vandalism or malicious mischief while held for sale.
